availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
I, Thomas E. Bramlette,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH,
TO ALL SHERIFFS AND CONSTABLES IN SAID COMMONWEALTH, GREETING:

WHEREAS, It has been made known to me by Wm G Brownlow Governor of the State of Tennessee that a certain John W Scales of said State stands indicted in the charged by affidavit & warrant Court for issued by Wm H Smith with the crime of Murder a copy of which indictment warrant dulyly authenticated, is now on file in this Department; and that the said John Scales -- has fled the State of , thereby evading the justice of its laws, and is going at large within the limits of the State of Kentucky.

Know Ye, Therefore, That I, THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE, Governor as aforesaid, do hereby require and enjoin all Sheriffis and Constables within this State to apprehend and arrest the said John W Scales, and upon his apprehension, to bring him before some Circuit Judge of this Commonwealth, that the Said Circuit Judge may proceed, by proper and legal testimony, to inquire into the matter, so far as shall be necessary, to ascertain the identity of the said John W Scales -- and if he is the person mentioned in this, my warrant, , that the said Judge may order him to be delivered up to Henry Clark --, who has been duly authorized by the Governor of the State of Tennessee to receive and convey the said John W Scales -- to the State of Tennessee --, to be dealt with according to law: And in case the said Henry Clark -- should not appear to receive him, that the Judge may commit him, the said John W Scales to jail, on the charge aforesaid, to be dealt with according to the law: and that you report forthwith to the Governor of this Commonwealth your proceedings under this warrant. And furthermore, that if the said John W Scales -- shall be committed to the jail of any county in this State, that the Judge so committing him may immediately inform the Governor of this Commonwealth of the comitment thereof, and to what jail he has been committed.

In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Seal of the Commonwealth to be affixed, at FRANKFORT, the 31st day of October in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty five, and in the 74th year of the Commonwealth.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p:
Thos E Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E L Van Winkle, SECRECTARY OF STATE.

November 3 1865 I have arested the prisner J. W Sales namd in the within proclamation and brought him before the Judge of the First Duttiteal Destrick of Kentucky and by his ordr have Delivrd Said prisner to Henry Clark as Derected by Said Judge
J C Calhoun sheriff of McCracken County Ky

On this 8th day of November 1865, Henry Clark produced and delivered to me the body of John W. Scales, to be taken by me as Jailer of said county and said John W. Scales was by me received from him and placed in the county jail of said county under the above mentioned charge. Witness my hand this 8th day of November 1865.
Michael Cody Jailor of Williamson County
